questions.question_text:
A sales rep at Universal Containers is configuring an amendment Quote. The original Quote featured a single annual Subscription with a Net Unit Price of $600, a Quantity of 10, and a Subscription Term of 24 months. Ten months into the term of the Contract, the sales rep wants to issue a prorated refund for the original purchase and quote a new, more expensive Subscription in its place.
Using the standard price waterfall, what is the expected Net Total of the amended Subscription once the Quantity is set to 0?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Price is $600/24 months, so $25 per unit per month. Order would have been for $600×10 quantity = $6000 for 10 units for 24 months. $6000/24 = $250 for 10 units per month. $250 x 14 = -$3,500 Refund (aka only $2,500 of the total $6,000 spend was used)

comments.content: Then you deduct it from the 6000 for the refund which is -2500.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I think it's 3500.
600 net price over 24 months = 25pm. Multiplied by 10 quantity is 250. Multiplied by 14 (24 months - 10 months used) = 3500

There is no great answer here, yet with that being said...
A is wrong altogether since if more than one record is returned via lookup it will result in an error
https://trailhead.salesforce.com/content/learn/modules/price-rules-in-salesforce-cpq/consolidate-price-rules-by-using-lookup-queries
B is simply too vague and is like an always true statement, it can be the right answer
C can also be true but it is out of scope
D is tricky on the wording since it is meaning something right but indeed tested field do not live on the lookup object

Selected Answer: C
D is not the correct answer because Tested Field in the lookup query refers to the object field you’re evaluating (for example Quote’s Net Amount)

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers is utilizing Lookup Price Rules to pull Daily Rate values from the Rental Rates object. After activating the Price Rule, the admin notices the Dally Rate value remains blank, but the user is still able to save the quote.
Which aspect of the Price Rule should the admin review to identify the underlying issue?

choices.B: Confirm the Conditions of the Price Rule are configured accurately based on expected behavior.
choices.A: Confirm the Lookup Queries of the Price Rule are configured to pull only a single referenced value from the Lookup object.
choices.C: Confirm the API Name selected in the SBQQ_LookupObject_c field on the Price Rule record is inputted accurately.
choices.D: Confirm the Tested Field(s) referenced in the Lookup Queries of the Price Rule exist on the Lookup object.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. New contracts inherit from the account; new accounts inherit from the installed package setting. However you also need to account for existing contracts and accounts.

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.cpq_amendment_field_guidelines.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: C
"You can also set Preserve Bundle Structure in Salesforce CPQ package settings or on the contract. Accounts inherit the Preserve Bundle Structure value from Salesforce CPQ line editor package settings. New contracts inherit the Preserve Bundle Structure value of its parent account."

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.cpq_amendment_field_guidelines.htm&type=5

questions.question_text:
Upon renewal of a Contract, a user has reported that bundles are being created without preserving the structure. This leads to validation errors and unwanted price changes. The admin has identified that Preserve Bundle Structure is set to FALSE on a system generated Contract record.
What should the admin do to prevent this issue from happening in the future?

choices.D: Set Preserve Bundle Structure to TRUE on existing Contract and Account Records, and update the Preserve Bundle Structure setting in the Installed Package Settings to TRUE.
choices.C: Set Preserve Bundle Structure to TRUE on existing Contract Records, and set field level security for Preserve Bundle Structure on the Contract object to only be editable by System Admins.
choices.B: Set Preserve Bundle Structure to TRUE on existing Account Records, and change the default field value on the Contract object to TRUE.
choices.A: Set Preserve Bundle Structure to TRUE on existing Account Records, and update the Re-evaluate Bundle Logic on Renewals, setting in the Installed Package Settings to TRUE.

questions.question_text:
The admin at Universal Containers set up a Price Rule to override List Price with a discounted promotional price. The Price Action has a formula which is as follows:
SBQQ_ListPrice_c* (1 – Promotional_Discount__c)
The admin is finding that every time Calculate is clicked, the price is adjusted. For example, if List Price is $10.00 and promotional discount is 10%.
10.00 * (1 – 0.10) = 9.00
The next time Calculate is clicked, the following calculation takes place:
9*(1 – 0.10) = 8.10
If List Price must be overridden, how can this problem be fixed?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
"Note that there is also the Original Price. This field also stores the list price of the product from the price book. If the list price of the quote line has been overwritten, you can still use the original price field to display the list price from the price book."

https://milomassimo.com/Salesforce-CPQ-Price-Waterfall.html

choices.C: The Salesforce CPQ package has an MSRP field which should be used instead of List Price in the formula
choices.D: The Salesforce CPQ package has an Original Price field which should be used instead of List Price in the formula.
choices.A: Create a field to hold the Price Book price, and populate Before Calculate with a Price Rule for use in the formula.
choices.B: Create a field to hold the Price Book price, and populate on Quote creation with a Workflow Rule for use in the formula.

choices.A: The hardware bundle and component-type Options can be split into separate Orders without preserving the bundle structure.
choices.C: The hardware bundle and component-type Options must be placed in the same Order together.
choices.B: The hardware bundle and component-type Options can be split using the Order By field.
choices.D: The hardware bundle and component-type Options can be split manually,

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
"Component product options can't be ordered separately from their parent bundles."

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.cpq_split_orders_guidelines.htm&type=5

Several of the accessories are component-type Options, with quantities dependent on the hardware. UC wants to begin using split Orders to manage a fulfillment process, with Orders broken out based on when items are shipped to the customer.
What should UC consider before implementing split Orders?
